name: fortinet-fortiproxy
label: Fortinet FortiProxy
description: FortiProxy provides a secure web gateway, which protects against web attacks with URL filtering, visibility and control of encrypted web traffic through SSL and SSH inspection, and application of granular web application policies. This connector facilitates automated operation related to firwall policy, firewall address, firewall address group, firewall service group, and banned users.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the FortiProxy server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key used to access the FortiProxy server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: api_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Firewall Policy
operations.description: Creates an firewall policy in FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Policy Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the policy whose firewall policy that you want to create in FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the policy whose firewall policy that you want to create in FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: Schedule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the schedule whose firewall policy that you want to create in FortiProxy server.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the schedule whose firewall policy that you want to create in FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: Source Interface

parameters.title: Policy Type
parameters.description: Specify the type of the policy, from the following available options: Explicit Web: Explicit Web Proxy policy, Transparent: Transparent firewall policy, Explicit FTP: Explicit FTP Proxy policy, SSH Tunnel: SSH Tunnel policy, SSH: SSH policy, Access Proxy: Access Proxy, or WanOpt: WANopt Tunnel
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the type of the policy, from the following available options: Explicit Web: Explicit Web Proxy policy, Transparent: Transparent firewall policy, Explicit FTP: Explicit FTP Proxy policy, SSH Tunnel: SSH Tunnel policy, SSH: SSH policy, Access Proxy: Access Proxy, or WanOpt: WANopt Tunnel

parameters.title: Status

parameters.description: Specify the force proxy for the policy, from the following available options: enable: Force all TCP transparent traffic to proxy or disable: Do not force TCP transparent traffic to proxy.

parameters.title: Policy Action
parameters.description: Specify the policy action for this policy, from the following available options: Accept: Allows session that match the firewall policy, Deny: Blocks sessions that match the firewall policy, Redirect: Redirect sessions that match the firewall policy to a url, or Isolate: Isolate sessions that match the firewall policy with isolator.

parameters.title: VDOM

vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

operations.title: Create Firewall Address
operations.description: Creates an firewall address in FortiProxy server based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Address Name
parameters.description: Specify the address name based on which you want to create an firewall address in FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the address name based on which you want to create an firewall address in FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: UUID
parameters.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).
parameters.name: uuid
parameters.tooltip: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).

parameters.title: Subnet
parameters.description: Specify the IP address and subnet mask of address based on which you want to create an firewall address in FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: subnet
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP address and subnet mask of address based on which you want to create an firewall address in FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: Address Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify the type of the address, from the following available options: IP Mask: Standard IPv4 address with subnet mask, IP Range: Range of IPv4 addresses between two specified addresses (inclusive), FQDN: Fully Qualified Domain Name address, Geography: IP addresses from a specified country, WildCard: Standard IPv4 using a wildcard subnet mask, Dynamic: Dynamic address object, Interface Subnet: IP and subnet of interface, or MAC: Range of MAC addresses.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the type of the address, from the following available options: IP Mask: Standard IPv4 address with subnet mask, IP Range: Range of IPv4 addresses between two specified addresses (inclusive), FQDN: Fully Qualified Domain Name address, Geography: IP addresses from a specified country, WildCard: Standard IPv4 using a wildcard subnet mask, Dynamic: Dynamic address object, Interface Subnet: IP and subnet of interface, or MAC: Range of MAC addresses.

parameters.title: Sub-Type Address
parameters.name: sub-type
parameters.description: Specify the Sub-type of address, from the following available options: SDN: SDN address, ClearPass SPT: ClearPass SPT (System Posture Token) address, FSSO: FSSO address, EMS Tag: FortiClient EMS tag, or SWC Tag: Switch Controller NAC policy tag.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Sub-type of address, from the following available options: SDN: SDN address, ClearPass SPT: ClearPass SPT (System Posture Token) address, FSSO: FSSO address, EMS Tag: FortiClient EMS tag, or SWC Tag: Switch Controller NAC policy tag.

parameters.description: Specify the System Posture Token, from the following available options: Unknown, Healthy, Quarantine, Checkup, Transient, or Infected
parameters.tooltip: Specify the System Posture Token, from the following available options: Unknown, Healthy, Quarantine, Checkup, Transient, or Infected

Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

Note: This parameter can only be used when the "Action" parameter is set to "move".

operations.title: Delete Firewall Service Group
operations.description: Deletes a specific firewall service group in FortiProxy server based on the address group name and other input parameter that you have specified.

parameters.title: Address Group Name
parameters.description: Specify the address group name based on which you want to delete firewall service group from FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the address group name based on which you want to delete firewall service group from FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.

vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

operations.title: DeAuthenticate Firewall Users
operations.description: Retrieves all de-authenticated firewall users of "authgrp" access group from FortiProxy server based on the user type, user ID, IP address, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: User Type
parameters.description: Specify the type of the user whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server. User type [proxy|firewall].
parameters.name: user_type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the type of the user whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server. User type [proxy|firewall].

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the user whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the user whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the IP address of the users whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: ip
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP address of the users whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: IP Version
parameters.description: Specify the IP version [ip4|ip6] of the users whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server. Only required if User Type is firewall.
parameters.name: ip_version
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP version [ip4|ip6] of the users whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server. Only required if User Type is firewall.

parameters.title: Authentication Method
parameters.description: Specify the authentication method [fsso|rsso|ntlm|firewall|wsso|fsso_citrix|sso_guest] of the users whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server. Only required if User Type is firewall.
parameters.name: method
parameters.tooltip: Specify the authentication method [fsso|rsso|ntlm|firewall|wsso|fsso_citrix|sso_guest] of the users whose de-authenticate firewall users you want to retrieve from FortiProxy server. Only required if User Type is firewall.

parameters.title: DeAuthenticate All Users
parameters.description: Set to true to de-authenticate all users. Note: If Specify, all other parameters will be ignored.
parameters.name: all
parameters.tooltip: Set to true to de-authenticate all users. Note: If Specify, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.title: Users
parameters.description: Array of user objects to de-authenticate. Use this to de-authenticate multiple users at once. Each object should include the above properties.
parameters.name: users
